fields.headline: Live music booking now
fields.bodyText: Toy continue their Korg-led motorik beat rise with more festival dates, including joining We Are Scientists, Tribes and the View at Kendal Calling (27-29 Jul, Lowther Deer Park, nr Penrith) ... Lady Gaga brings her Born This Way Ball to two UK dates (8 Sep, Twickenham Stadium, TW2; 11 Sep, Manchester Arena) with rockers the Darkness in support, just in case there's not enough glitter and spandex on stage ... Dance-ruling old blokes Orbital provide pre-Christmas rave antics (3-14 Dec, tour begins O2 Academy, Bristol) ... Shaman-bard bluesy keyboard tinkler Dr John capitalises on his Dan Auerbach-produced recent album with a headline slot at the SummerTyne Americana Festival (20-22 Jul, Sage Gateshead) ... Meanwhile High Flying Bird Noel Gallagher adds a Wembley Arena date to his current tour (4-10 Sep, tour begins BIC, Bournemouth) ... Cathedral trumps arena for a venue, though, as anthemic indie trio the Enemy launch their new album, Streets In The Sky with two dates at Coventry Cathedral (21 & 22 May).
